Is it, as has been thought, an internal monitor implanted
in us by the Supreme Being, and dictating to us, on all
occasions, what is right or wrong? Or is it merely our
own judgment of the moral rectitude or turpitude of our
own actions? I take the word (with Mr. Locke) in the
latter, as in the only intelligible sense. Now who sees
not that our judgments of virtue and vice, right and
wrong, are not always formed from an enlightened and
